mimosaB5Module.name: mimosaB5Module
mimosaB5Module.contactinfo: postal: Mimosa Networks, Inc. 469 El Camino Real Ste 100 Santa Clara, CA 95050 email: support@mimosa.co

mimosaDeviceName.name: mimosaDeviceName
mimosaDeviceName.description: The name of the local Mimosa device. This unique identifier could be the same as the sysName object.

mimosaSerialNumber.name: mimosaSerialNumber
mimosaSerialNumber.description: The unique serial number of the Mimosa device.

mimosaFirmwareVersion.name: mimosaFirmwareVersion
mimosaFirmwareVersion.description: The version of the currently installed and/or running firmware on the Mimosa device.

mimosaFirmwareBuildDate.name: mimosaFirmwareBuildDate
mimosaFirmwareBuildDate.description: The creation date of the currently installed and/or running firmware on the Mimosa device.

mimosaLastRebootTime.name: mimosaLastRebootTime
mimosaLastRebootTime.description: The last time the Mimosa device rebooted.

mimosaUnlockCode.name: mimosaUnlockCode
mimosaUnlockCode.description: The code used to unlock the Mimosa device.

mimosaLEDBrightness.name: mimosaLEDBrightness
mimosaLEDBrightness.description: Indicates the intensity of the status indicator lights on the device exterior. The Auto option adjusts the amount of light based upon ambient conditions. Manual options include Low, Medium, and High.

mimosaInternalTemp.name: mimosaInternalTemp
mimosaInternalTemp.description: The internal temperature of the Mimosa device.

mimosaRegulatoryDomain.name: mimosaRegulatoryDomain
mimosaRegulatoryDomain.description: The country in which the Mimosa device has been configured to run.

mimosaLongitude.name: mimosaLongitude
mimosaLongitude.description: The Longitude of the Mimosa device location, in 5 decimal points.

mimosaLatitude.name: mimosaLatitude
mimosaLatitude.description: The Latitude of the Mimosa device location, in 5 decimal points.

mimosaAltitude.name: mimosaAltitude
mimosaAltitude.description: The Altitude of the Mimosa device location in meters.

mimosaSatelliteSNR.name: mimosaSatelliteSNR
mimosaSatelliteSNR.description: The average Signal to Noise Ratio (SNR) amongst all of the satellites detected by the Mimosa device. Display is in 1 decimal point.

mimosaSatelliteStrength.name: mimosaSatelliteStrength
mimosaSatelliteStrength.description: Strength of the satellites based on the number of satellites available. It is considered good if more than 2 satellites are available.

mimosaGPSSatellites.name: mimosaGPSSatellites
mimosaGPSSatellites.description: Total number of GPS satellites detected.

mimosaGlonassSatellites.name: mimosaGlonassSatellites
mimosaGlonassSatellites.description: Total number of GLONASS satellites detected.

mimosaClockAccuracy.name: mimosaClockAccuracy
mimosaClockAccuracy.description: Timing signal accuracy measured in parts per billion (PPB) by the Mimosa device. Display is in 2 decimal points.

mimosaWirelessMode.name: mimosaWirelessMode
mimosaWirelessMode.description: Describes wherger the Mimosa device acts as an access point or station.

mimosaWirelessProtocol.name: mimosaWirelessProtocol
mimosaWirelessProtocol.description: Describes the wireless protocol configured on the Mimosa device. Both TDMA and CSMA are supported. TDMA is a deterministic protocol where each device is assigned a time slot during which it is allowed to transmit. This allows for collocated radios to utilize the same channel and avoid Tx/Rx collisions and interference.

mimosaTDMAMode.name: mimosaTDMAMode
mimosaTDMAMode.description: Specifies the TDMA Gender of the radio (A or B).

mimosaTDMAWindow.name: mimosaTDMAWindow
mimosaTDMAWindow.description: Specifies the length of the transmit time slot in milliseconds.

mimosaTrafficSplit.name: mimosaTrafficSplit
mimosaTrafficSplit.description: The radio can be configured to allocate bandwidth symmetrically (50/50) or asymmetrically (75/25 or 25/75) in environments where traffic direction is expected to be heavier in one direction than the other. With an asymmetrical split, the local radio is represented first in the slash notation, (local/remote). For example, in the (75/25) split, the local radio gets 75, while the remote radio gets 25. If Auto is selected the radio will automatically determine, based upon traffic flow, which ratio will be used. The radio will continue to evaluate the flow and adjust accordingly.

mimosaChainTable.name: mimosaChainTable
mimosaChainTable.description: A list of RF chain entries, which is part of MIMO tables. MIMO stands for Multiple In Multiple Out.

mimosaChainEntry.name: mimosaChainEntry
mimosaChainEntry.description: An entry containing chain information applicable to a particular RF chain.

mimosaChain.name: mimosaChain
mimosaChain.description: An index which is used to access a particular entry in the chain table.

mimosaTxPower.name: mimosaTxPower
mimosaTxPower.description: Specifies the transmit power of the given RF chain. A value of -8 means this particular TxChain is not a valid entry.

mimosaRxPower.name: mimosaRxPower
mimosaRxPower.description: Specifies the receive power of the given RF chain. A value of -100 means this particular RxChain is not a valid entry (SNR must be -100).

mimosaRxNoise.name: mimosaRxNoise
mimosaRxNoise.description: Specifies the received noise level for the given RF chain.

mimosaSNR.name: mimosaSNR
mimosaSNR.description: Indicates the Signal to Noise Ratio (SNR) for the given RF chain. A value of -100 means this particular RxChain is not a valid entry.

mimosaCenterFreq.name: mimosaCenterFreq
mimosaCenterFreq.description: The center frequency for the given RF chain. A value of 0 means this particular Chain is not a valid entry.

mimosaPolarization.name: mimosaPolarization
mimosaPolarization.description: The ploarization of the given RF chain. It could be horizontal or vertical.

mimosaStreamTable.name: mimosaStreamTable
mimosaStreamTable.description: A list of data stream entries, which are part of MIMO tables. MIMO stands for Multiple In Multiple Out.

mimosaStreamEntry.name: mimosaStreamEntry
mimosaStreamEntry.description: The entry containing information applicable to a particular stream.

mimosaStream.name: mimosaStream
mimosaStream.description: The index used to access a particular entry in the stream table.

mimosaTxPhy.name: mimosaTxPhy
mimosaTxPhy.description: Specifies the transmit rate of the given data stream.

mimosaTxMCS.name: mimosaTxMCS
mimosaTxMCS.description: Specifies the transmit MCS of the given data stream. A value of -1 means this particular TxStream is not a valid entry.

mimosaTxWidth.name: mimosaTxWidth
mimosaTxWidth.description: Specifies the channel width based on MCS. A value of -1 means this particular TxWidth is not a valid entry

mimosaRxPhy.name: mimosaRxPhy
mimosaRxPhy.description: Specifies the receive rate of the given data stream.

mimosaRxMCS.name: mimosaRxMCS
mimosaRxMCS.description: Specifies the receive MCS of the given data stream. A value of -1 means this particular RxStream is not a valid entry.

mimosaRxWidth.name: mimosaRxWidth
mimosaRxWidth.description: Specifies the receive Rx Width of the given data stream. A value of -1 means this particular RxWidth is not a valid entry.

mimosaRxEVM.name: mimosaRxEVM
mimosaRxEVM.description: Specifies the receive Error Vector Magnitude (EVM) of the given data stream.

mimosaChannelTable.name: mimosaChannelTable
mimosaChannelTable.description: A list of RF channel entries on the Mimosa device.

mimosaChannelEntry.name: mimosaChannelEntry
mimosaChannelEntry.description: The entry containing management information applicable to a particular channel.

mimosaChannel.name: mimosaChannel
mimosaChannel.description: The index used to access a particular entry in the RF channel table.

mimosaChannelMode.name: mimosaChannelMode
mimosaChannelMode.description: Specifies the mode for the given channel. The transmit or receive values indicate Frequency Diversity (FD) mode is in use. The bidirectional value means that the channel is used for both transmit and receive in all other single or dual channel modes.

mimosaChannelWidth.name: mimosaChannelWidth
mimosaChannelWidth.description: Specifies the channel width of the given channel.

mimosaChannelTxPower.name: mimosaChannelTxPower
mimosaChannelTxPower.description: Specifies the transmit power level on the channel. If Channel Width is set to 1xN MHz, Channel 2 is not be used. In Frequency Diversity mode, Power 1 and Power 2 represent transmit power on the local and remote sides, respectively.

mimosaChannelCenterFreq.name: mimosaChannelCenterFreq
mimosaChannelCenterFreq.description: Specifies the center frequency of the channel used on the link. In all modes, the center frequency represents the absolute center of the selected channel width without any offset, and the center can be moved in 5 MHz increments. A value of 0 means this particular channel is not a valid entry.

mimosaAntennaGain.name: mimosaAntennaGain
mimosaAntennaGain.description: The antenna gain on the Mimosa device.

mimosaTotalTxPower.name: mimosaTotalTxPower
mimosaTotalTxPower.description: The total transmit power for all the channels on the Mimosa device.

mimosaTotalRxPower.name: mimosaTotalRxPower
mimosaTotalRxPower.description: The total receive power for all the channels on the Mimosa device.

mimosaTargetSignalStrength.name: mimosaTargetSignalStrength
mimosaTargetSignalStrength.description: The calculated target receive signal strength based on device coordinates and settings.

mimosaWanSsid.name: mimosaWanSsid
mimosaWanSsid.description: The wireless link name used by both radios. Both AP and Station must use the same SSID to communicate with each other.

mimosaWanMac.name: mimosaWanMac
mimosaWanMac.description: The MAC address used for the wireless link.

mimosaWanStatus.name: mimosaWanStatus
mimosaWanStatus.description: The wireless link status between the Mimosa devices.

mimosaWanUpTime.name: mimosaWanUpTime
mimosaWanUpTime.description: The wireless link up time since last reboot.

mimosaPhyTxRate.name: mimosaPhyTxRate
mimosaPhyTxRate.description: The transmit packet rate at the physical level over a 5 second interval.

mimosaPhyRxRate.name: mimosaPhyRxRate
mimosaPhyRxRate.description: The receive packet rate at the physical level over a 5 second interval.

mimosaPerTxRate.name: mimosaPerTxRate
mimosaPerTxRate.description: The trasnmit Packet Error Rate (PER) over a 5 second interval. It is caluculated as packets with errors versuss packets without errors.

mimosaPerRxRate.name: mimosaPerRxRate
mimosaPerRxRate.description: The receive Packet Error Rate (PER) over a 5 second interval. It is caluculated as packets with errors versuss packets without errors.

mimosaNetworkMode.name: mimosaNetworkMode
mimosaNetworkMode.description: Specifies the mode for the local 2.4 GHz wireless network operation. If Auto is selected, the 2.4 GHz management network is turned on for a limited time (defined in Console Timeout ) after boot and then turned off if there is no activity. If a user associates with the radio within the timeout period, they will not be disconnected.

mimosaRecoverySsid.name: mimosaRecoverySsid
mimosaRecoverySsid.description: The recovery SSID that allows the device to be reset to factory defaults. This is available for 10 minutes after device boot. Disabling the 2.4 GHz management network will not impact availability of this option. The serial number of the device must be known in order to perform the factory reset.

mimosaLocalSsid.name: mimosaLocalSsid
mimosaLocalSsid.description: The SSID for managing the local 2.4 GHz wireless interface.

mimosaLocalChannel.name: mimosaLocalChannel
mimosaLocalChannel.description: The channel used for the local 2.4 GHz wireless interface.

mimosaConsoleTimeout.name: mimosaConsoleTimeout
mimosaConsoleTimeout.description: The amount inactivity on the 2.4 GHz wireless interface before turning it off in Auto mode.

mimosaMaxClients.name: mimosaMaxClients
mimosaMaxClients.description: The maximum number of wireless clients that can simultaneously access the 2.4 GHz management interface.

mimosaLocalMac.name: mimosaLocalMac
mimosaLocalMac.description: The MAC address used for 2.4 GHz wireless link.

mimosaLocalIpAddr.name: mimosaLocalIpAddr
mimosaLocalIpAddr.description: The IP address assigned to the 2.4 GHz wireless link.

mimosaLocalNetMask.name: mimosaLocalNetMask
mimosaLocalNetMask.description: The IP netmask assigned to the 2.4 GHz wireless link.

mimosaLocalGateway.name: mimosaLocalGateway
mimosaLocalGateway.description: The IP address of the gateway for the 2.4 GHz wireless link.

mimosaFlowControl.name: mimosaFlowControl
mimosaFlowControl.description: Specifies whether Flow Control is enabled on the Mimosa device.

mimosaHttpsEnabled.name: mimosaHttpsEnabled
mimosaHttpsEnabled.description: Specifies whether HTTPS is enabled on the Mimosa device.

mimosaMgmtVlanEnabled.name: mimosaMgmtVlanEnabled
mimosaMgmtVlanEnabled.description: Specifies whether the Management VLAN is enabled on the Mimosa device.

mimosaMgmtCloudEnabled.name: mimosaMgmtCloudEnabled
mimosaMgmtCloudEnabled.description: Specifies whether the Management Cloud is enabled on the Mimosa device.

mimosaRestMgmtEnabled.name: mimosaRestMgmtEnabled
mimosaRestMgmtEnabled.description: Specifies whether the REST management is enabled on the Mimosa device.

mimosaPingWatchdogEnabled.name: mimosaPingWatchdogEnabled
mimosaPingWatchdogEnabled.description: Specifies whether the IP Ping watchdog is enabled on the Mimosa device. This is used to reset the device if a configured IP address is not reached in certain number of retries.

mimosaSyslogEnabled.name: mimosaSyslogEnabled
mimosaSyslogEnabled.description: Specifies whether the Syslog client is enabled on the Mimosa device. Syslog client sends the log messages to configured syslog server.

mimosaNtpMode.name: mimosaNtpMode
mimosaNtpMode.description: Specifies whether the NTP client is configured to use standard servers from NIST, NTP organizations or custom NTP server.

mimosaNtpServer.name: mimosaNtpServer
mimosaNtpServer.description: Specifies the name or address of the custom NTP server.
